page.title: 06Ghost Walks O.K.
page.content: {Hatherop Castle}was built by Sir John Bloomer. One of his daughters, Anna Maria,married a man named Lord Derwentwater. During the Jacobite rebellion Lord Derwentwater offended the crown,a warrant was issued for his arrest.When he was taken from the house his wife watched from behind a particular window. Lord Derwentwater was executed in the customary manner for nobles by being beheaded.Lord Derwentwater lost his head on Tower Hill on the twenty fourth of Febuary 1716.Local legend claims two supernatural occurrences. Finger marks appear on the window where Lady Derwentwater last saw her husband.In a particular aisle of trees known as Yew Tree Walk the ghost of {continued on page 7
